citing_paper_authors: Sampo, Pyysalo | Tomoko, Ohta | Jin-Dong, Kim | Jun'ichi, Tsujii
raw_text: Domain noun com pound semantics, including static relations, have been considered in studies by (Rosario and Hearst, 2001) and (Nakov et al, 2005), but in IE settings static relations tend to appear only implicitly, as in the RelEx causal RE system of (Fundel et al, 2007), or through the causal relations they imply: for ex ample, in the AIMed corpus (Bunescu et al, 2005) statements such as NE1/NE2 complex are annotated as a binding relation between the two NEs, not Part Whole relations with the broader entity
clean_text: Domain noun compound semantics, including static relations, have been considered in studies by (Rosario and Hearst, 2001) and (Nakov et al, 2005), but in IE settings static relations tend to appear only implicitly, as in the RelEx causal RE system of (Fundel et al, 2007), or through the causal relations they imply: for example, in the AIMed corpus (Bunescu et al, 2005) statements such as NE1/NE2 complex are annotated as a binding relation between the two NEs, not Part Whole relations with the broader entity.
